title: Bug 5340: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
description: When attempting to cancel the process of adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately. However, the exception list still comes up, ignoring the cancellation request. The expected behavior is either for the cancellation request to be honored, or for the cancel button to be disabled. To achieve this, when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run, the 'cancellable' parameter should be set to false.
OB: When adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately upon clicking cancel. However, the exception list still appears.
EB: When adding an exception breakpoint and clicking cancel in the progress dialog, the process should be cancelled and the exception list should not appear.
SR:
1) Open the debug perspective
2) Go to the breakpoints pane
3) Click the J! button to add an exception breakpoint
4) In the progress dialog, click cancel
